Reviews.Content: Wouldn't stay here again Our room was very, very tiny and very ugly. There were two of us and only one at a time could walk sideways around the bed. There was hardly any space to put our clothes and suite cases. Most of our things we left packed and shoved our suitcases under the bed. There was an eye stinging bright blue faux finish on the wall. My friend joked that it was a faux pas finish.In addition to this it was noisy. Our room was right off the lobby and every drunken reveler (and there were a few) plus the loud conversations of the hotel manager and staff kept us up at night and woke us early in the morning.Also there was mold in the shower. Not a good thing.What I can say is that the hotel is in a convenient location and there were lot's of good restaurants around us. It's also close to the train station; just a few minutes walk.
Reviews.Author: movingon42

Reviews.Content: Good and OK My wife, daughter and I stayed at the Goldoni for three nights in April 2007. We choose the hotel because it is near our son's apartment. Because Florence is a walking city, the location is fine. As a matter of fact, its location is better than another hotel we stayed in on an earlier occasion, because it is away from the center of the city, where all of the crowds are. The breakfast was very good: cereals, pastries, yogurt, cappucino made at your request. The staff was exceedingly helpful and pleasant. My only suggestion is to make sure that you get a room far away from the reception area, as it tends to get noisy. It is on the second floor of the building, and it has a neat lift with double wooden/glass door.
Reviews.Author: snresq

Reviews.Content: Good hotel, but... I liked the hotel. Everything was good: location, building, room (though a little small for a double but with a tiny balcony), bathroom (shower cabin is just a part of the bathroom separated with the transparent door, but spacious, good water jet), breakfast was not bad at all. Just one thing was bad: the elevator was terrible audible all night long. It was twice unpleasant as long as I asked a silent room when I booked this hotel. We got a room next to the reception.
Reviews.Author: Guest0987

Reviews.Content: Hotel Goldini -- so so This was a pretty mundane hotel with a cool elevator. It was well located although off the beaten path and very quiet. The bathroom had a kind of strange smell that lasted throughout the 3 days there. Also the room was decorated as if the furniture came from Rent-a-center. A blue mirrored headboard? The walls were sponge painted. It was fine but nothing special. Also, it was strange that although breakfast was free, they charged extra for cappucino and espresso in the morning. Coffee from a machine was available for free. Some of the staff were quite pleasant. One woman made us feel very uncomfortable there. I would look for a different place were I to return to Florence.
Reviews.Author: drslamb

Reviews.Content: Second stay at the Goldoni. It's the 3rd time we have stayed in Florence, as well as visiting the Italian Lakes and Sorrento over the years. We stayed at the Goldoni about 5 years ago and when we revisited Florence this September we decided to stay there again. We've sampled some three star hotels in Italy and for a city centre hotel, the Goldoni certainly deserves its three star status. Yes, it's on the 2nd floor. The layout may be corridor like( reading other reviews) but it's in a very old building...that's Florence! Our triple room was spacious, well furnished and very clean. The buffet breakfast typically continental with a good variety of food. (No toast machine, no scrambled egg and bacon...oh dear!) The staff couldn't be more helpful. If we ever travel to Florence in the future I know where we will most likely stay!
Reviews.Author: TheWallers

Reviews.Content: Charming Hotel with olde world ambience After entering the lobby of the building that this hotel is situated in and noting the ancient wooden elevator which, combined with the grey stone staircase (which we relentlessly used as my daughter would not use the elevator!) look like something out of 1930s New York Gangster movies, you arrive at the 2nd floor to an unusual but charming 3 star hotel. On one side of the small landing are the rooms and on the other the reception and breakfast room and this is about it as far as the hotel facilities go! Our family room (1 double and 2 single beds) was spacious, furnished traditionally in dark polished wood with a writing desk and dining table included, with a small but adequate fresh bathroom , lovely tiled floor throughout and a view out the window of some sort of air shaft! Location and Florence itself, however, made up for any disappointment in having to negotiate more than 1 person being in the bathroom at the same time and the window view. The hotel's claim to fame as being somewhere Mozart had once stayed and it's intent to create a bygone atmosphere with the furnishings and decor gives the Goldoni an aura of Florence in olden times which , combined with the city's architecture, sights etc left us with a great impression of the city although my 13 year old found the Goldoni hotel to be a bit spooky. Overall we were happy with our stay at the hotel versus the cost and quite liked the old fashioned charm but would agree with other reviewers that the breakfast coffee machine coffee is not a good touch. All other hotels that we visited during our trip served large cups of freshly made capuccino! No other complaints though - good location, friendly , helpful staff. This review is based on a spacious family room with 3 beds .
Reviews.Author: CH109

Reviews.Content: Could do better! When you arrive the entry staircase is a bit of a shock because the Hotel lives on the second floor but you get used to it. The Goldoni is a pleasant proprietor run hotel, he keeps a low profile with the consequent lack of attention to detail, though the staff were helpful when asked. Considering Florence is an expensive place to be the hotel was reasonable value and well situated. My wife and I stayed for six nights and for that duration the room was far too small and stuffy. I would go back (but only to a bigger room) and suggest you give it a try but beware of the zanzaris and perhaps the addition of some fruit would avoid me callling the breakfast PDB (pure dead boring).
Reviews.Author: silverskater

Reviews.Content: Won't be staying again The Goldoni is in an excellent location, however we were very dissapointed with our room. Basically we were just in a room that was obviously once a hallway and they have just put some walls around it and made it into a bedroom. Would no stay there again however we found the staff to be very friendly and helpful.
Reviews.Author: kingnoel

Reviews.Content: 3* Gem We stayed here for 3 nights recently on a special low season rate of 75 euros per night (incl. tax and breakfast). What a charming find! We debated whether to plump for usual 5* comfort or settle for a moderate hotel to enable our spending money to go further, given that Florence is a shopper's haven! We definitely made the right choice with the Goldoni. For history buffs, the Goldoni is known as the hotel where Mozart once stayed (the site of rooms 50 and 51). A Japanese film crew will shortly descend upon the hotel as part of a documentary being produced to commemorate the 250th anniversary of his birth. The Goldoni is very well located just 30 seconds behind the Arno, 5-10 minutes from Ponte/Vecchio and the Uffizi, 10 minutes from the station, along a street lined with tempting retromodern furnishings/antique and jewellery boutiques! The hotel is very cosy, clean and quiet (NB size of rooms do vary so be sure to ask for one of the bigger rooms). Service was charming and friendly (look out for Daniella on the front desk who is full of good tips about where to eat, making ticket reservations at museums etc). Definitely recommend this hotel!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: A lovely place I stayed here with my mother in May 2004, and it was a lovely place. We had a room for two, and it had two twin beds. The TV was tiny, but I didn't come to Florence to stay inside. The bathroom was small but marbled from floor to ceiling, and was sufficient for what we needed. The room was clean, and the sheets were white and clean. A great place to sleep after a whole day of touring. Don't let the outside fool you. The building looks old from the outside. Take the elevator up to the 2nd floor and that's where the hotel actually is.The breakfast was included in our price. Toast, yogurt, cold cereal, milk, juices, coffees and teas. They had nice semi-soft cheeses from Switzerland which were particularly nice, and the greatest cookies you could take with you for the day.It was about a 5 minute walk to the river, and another 5 to the major sights.The best part about the area was a price fix locals-only restaurant about 3-4 blocks away. Ten euros fixed price and you got the following: glass of wine, soft drink, and 3 courses. Salad, pasta, and your choice of meat with 1 or 2 sides. Locals were watching soccer on the tv. There were about 10 tables int he whole place. It was so good we went two nights in a row! If anyone is interested I can look for the name and the street. Start a new post, and I will answer it.
Reviews.Author: DMinBoston

Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the hotel and would return       Breakfast / dining room
Reviews.Author: EdinColorado

Reviews.Content: Terrific Hotel, worth every cent I must say I'm extremely surprised to read negative reviews of this hotel, but let me say there is absolutely nothing to worry about unless you're an extreme hotel snob. It is definitely worthy of 3-stars, it was 5 times better than many of the other 3-star hotels we stayed in in Italy. The place was lovely, tastefully decorated and the young staff were the friendliest we came across in our travels  had perfect English (though the owner and his wife were a bit sour). Location couldn't have been better, quiet but close to everything, but then, there is no such thing as a bad location in Florence because the city is so compact. We walked from the station to the hotel and it was a pretty 5 min walk to the main street  duomo. I do not believe that anyone could complain about the breakfast as it was fantastic, with ham, cheese, rolls, cereal, cakes, muffins, biscuits, pastries etc. and the breakfast room was light and airy. We had a 3 person room which was very big and a large modern bathroom as well. All this for 105 EUR per night!! The rate went up to 155 on our 4th night becaue high season rates came in but it was still a bargain. When I go back to Florence I won't even bother looking anywhere else for accommodation, this was too good to pass up.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: average at best My husband and I stayed two nights in June 2004 at this hotel with our college-age daughter and would not stay here again. The location was just OK and compared to the other hotels we stayed at in Rome, Sienna, and Venice, we would rate the Goldoni as average. Our room was satisfactory, but the breakfast was absolutely terrible. For the price, there are many more places to stay.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: A 2 star hotel There is no way this hotel should have 3 stars. It is very small, with no faciliies. The bathroom seemed to have been lifted out of the 1970's and the staff were not at all friendly. I felt it was more of a hostel than a hotel.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: So,So A very small and unusual hotel with few services. Our room was average for Italy but had tile flooring -- no carpeting at all -- which made it seem very cold and unfriendly. Also the lighting is harsh and mostly from overhead florescent lights which are not at all pleasant.Usual Italian very small bathroom. Our double bed were twins that had been pushed together. There was a large gap which was uncomfortable. Walls are thin and we heard all the crying and kid noise of the family with children next door.Nice breakfast.There are better bargins in Florence.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Hotel Goldoni We stayed at the Hotel Goldoni for 2 nights in early March, 2004. We arrived after dark, and when the taxi driver left us in front of the closed door, we were a little apprehensive. Not to worry! After we were buzzed in and rode the old, but unique, elevator to the 3rd floor, we arrived at an excellent hotel. The front desk staff was most helpful in answering all our questions.We had a quad room...a large bed (2 twins) and 2 separate twin beds...that was really large. We had more than enough space to spread out. The only window looked out to an airshaft. The bath was large enough and everything worked well.The breakfast room was tasteful with an excellent breakfast...breads, yogurt, cheese, beverages. The only thing that bothered me about the breakfast was that a machine made the coffee and we never quite mastered how to get it to dispense coffee like we liked it in the 2 mornings we were there.The location of the hotel was great; we walked to all the major sites we wanted to see.The only difficulty we had was finding restaurants near the hotel that were affordable and appropriate for our family of 4.We would definitely stay at the Hotel Goldoni again!
Reviews.Author: PlanoRick

Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel A very nice hotel, central and recently renovated. Tasteful interior and very nice and helpful staff. Parking is available for a special hotel price of 20 Euros per night (instead of 40).
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: nice surprise Terriffic small boutique hotel - inexpensive and in a very good location near Piazza Santa Maria Novella ( train station ) Very friendly staff - could not have been more helpful . The hotel is one block from the Arno and about a five minute walk to Ponte Vecchio . Great small /non touristy restaurants close to hotel . Rooms are clean and comfortable though not luxurious - really no view from our room . I would stay there again when in Florence . There is no restaurant in the hotel but they provide a very nice breakfast .
Reviews.Author: jrlSouthernPines_NC
